lead_paragraph: The Cleveland Cavaliers offered LeBron James a five-year maximum contract extension worth about $80 million, a deal that could keep him in Cleveland through the 2012-13 season. The Cavaliers have exclusive negotiating rights with James this summer. If he chooses not to sign this summer, he can become a restricted free agent after the 2006-7 season.
